alert.note: Alert for Southern San Luis Valley; Southern Sangre De Cristo Mountains Above 11000 Ft; Southern Sangre De Cristo Mountains Between 7500 and 11000 Ft (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 26 at 5:20PM MDT by NWS Pueblo
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southern Costilla County through 600 PM MDT... At 520 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near San Luis, or 22 miles southwest of Spring Burn Scar south of Highway 160 in Costilla county, moving northwest at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... San Luis, San Acacio, San Pablo, Fort Garland, Sanchez Reservoir and Chama. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Southern San Luis Valley; Southern Sangre De Cristo Mountains Above 11000 Ft; Southern Sangre De Cristo Mountains Between 7500 and 11000 Ft
